channel.title: Connecting Error
channel.description: Hello im running a 317 and i have my portforwarding all set up i can see my port is open on canyouseeme, my no-ip is set up correctly, however it will not connect any idea's on what could be preventing me from connecting ? thank you.

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

First re port forward
Then you need to make sure you changed all the files like client.java with the no-ip.
If it doesn’t work, i am sorry that i couldn’t help.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

For you to connect it needs to be set on 127.0.0.1 it’s somehow sets it as localhost so you can connect

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

If the port-forwarding is correct, make sure the ip is set in the client, and you’ve successfully compiled the client after changing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“deanooo386, post:6, topic:477816”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=596011.msg4196436#msg4196436 date=1357572266]
Just so you know, No-IP isn’t REQUIRED in a server network set-up, scratch No-IP and try connecting directly to your IP. (www.whatsmyip.org)
[/quote]

it does not connect when i change it to my ip address or my .no-ip, it works when it 127.0.0.1
but my ports are open is there a ip you need to change on the server side ?

Also i just read something hopefully you can verify hoster “HAS” to connect on 127.0.0.1 and other have to connect via ip ?

Because im trying to connect locally using my .no-ip to see if it works lol[/quote]

You shouldn’t connect locally using your no-ip, it may work, not sure. Try having a friend connect or something, I’d even check it for you quick if you private message me a link.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @deanooo386 deanooo386
item.description:
@deanooo386 wrote:

The Web Guy:

Just so you know, No-IP isn’t REQUIRED in a server network set-up, scratch No-IP and try connecting directly to your IP. (www.whatsmyip.org)

it does not connect when i change it to my ip address or my .no-ip, it works when it 127.0.0.1
but my ports are open is there a ip you need to change on the server side ?

Also i just read something hopefully you can verify hoster “HAS” to connect on 127.0.0.1 and other have to connect via ip ?

Because im trying to connect locally using my .no-ip to see if it works lol

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

if you downloaded your server off the internet somewhere and this is your first time connecting it make sure the client is connecting to the right ip address in your client source code

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Just so you know, No-IP isn’t REQUIRED in a server network set-up, scratch No-IP and try connecting directly to your IP. (www.whatsmyip.org)

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @deanooo386 deanooo386
item.description:
@deanooo386 wrote:

in ip config it says ipv4 = 192.168.0.2 my router is portforwarding 43594 to 192.168.0.2 and on canyouseeme.org i type 43594 and it says that it is openo i cannot see it being a portforwarding issue ? when i type my .no-ip address in my url it takes me to my router loggin screen so it all seems set up right just not connecting windows firewall is turned off and i have no antivirus.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Error
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

Probably not port-forwarding correctly

Read full topic
